channel.title: [PI] Snippet GUI
channel.description:
Hey I've made a new command generator, tell me what you think. [IMG]http://i1215.photobucket.com/albums/cc515/Marine5287/cmdgen.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i1215.photobucket.com/albums/cc515/Marine5287/cmdgen2.png[/img]
This is coded with visual basic. Yes, it's poorly coded, but it gets the job done.
Credits
Marine5287 owner nitro Visual Basic 2010

item.title: [PI] Snippet GUI
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Jmood:

I don’t see how you cannot learn Java from an rsps, if you use a source like Apollo to figure out the protocol and then read the java docs and tutorials you should be able to learn Java just as easy as reading and writing a calculator or another program… I suggest if you wish to learn with out gaining a lot of bad habits you should try to stay away from servers that have 4-5 years of hundreds of peoples code that are just packed in to 20 different classes…

Apollo or Azure I can understand, even then I’d still rather Java through the development of programs. But 99% of any RSPS community will not use these, they all go for the easier bases i.e PI. This is when you don’t learn Java, you maybe learn how to use variables and write an array, but the way they’re utilized is nothing compared to how Java really works, as I’m sure you know.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Snippet GUI
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

I don’t see how you cannot learn Java from an rsps, if you use a source like Apollo to figure out the protocol and then read the java docs and tutorials you should be able to learn Java just as easy as reading and writing a calculator or another program… I suggest if you wish to learn with out gaining a lot of bad habits you should try to stay away from servers that have 4-5 years of hundreds of peoples code that are just packed in to 20 different classes…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Snippet GUI
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:37, topic:399835”]If people were wanting to learn how to program properly they wouldn’t be on the RSPS scene, as David said, you could be create one of the best RSPS out there and know nothing when it comes to real Java.

Java is nothing like RSPS shit, only a select few RSPS programmers actually know the Java language.[/quote]
Just to add on again;

If people really wanted to learn java, they wouldn’t be using RSPS. But, if they wanted to learn using RSPS. They could always use the Java API and the the API that the sources have. If you get where I’m coming from.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Snippet GUI
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Just to add to the gravedig I had to pick up on this;

Ollie123:

Pointless and shit! People should learn to program properly instead of using shitty VB command generators!

If people were wanting to learn how to program properly they wouldn’t be on the RSPS scene, as David said, you could be create one of the best RSPS out there and know nothing when it comes to real Java.

Java is nothing like RSPS shit, only a select few RSPS programmers actually know the Java language.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Snippet GUI
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

Davidi2:

I learned the basics through RSPS, yes. But trust me, you may be able to make the best featured RSPS ever and still suck at Java. It takes external practice and learning to really learn Java, there’s only so much you can teach yourself without using any tools.

I have a Java book, but cba to read it yet. I get bored of programming every few months so I don’t really want to start the book then get bored and leave it. You understand?

Read full topic

item.description:

@vManlyMan wrote:

Davidi2:

0 years. All I knew was Visual basic when I started RSPS, now I realize how bad VB is and I’m writing a MORPG game in Java right now

Ahh. So you learned Java while doing RSPS? That’s cool. Did you learn through RSPS, or did you read up on it?

item.title: [PI] Snippet GUI
item.dc:creator: @bamdude37 bamdude37
item.description:
@bamdude37 wrote:

[quote=“vManlyMan, post:25, topic:399835”][quote author=Marine5287 link=topic=496950.msg3633625#msg3633625 date=1308432474]

Pointless topic is pointless. If you want to release it, release it.

But… why Visual Basic… WHYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY

I didn’t know any other program
[/quote]

Learn C#. It’s just as simple, and you won’t get ridiculed for it.

[quote]Quote from: Uncalled on June 21, 2011, 04:23:17 PM
Try making it to where you need to add the inputs of the command [such as for the teleport command you type the x,y,h coords and the player rights] then when you’re done, it will automatically add the command into your Commands class.

That’d be great, if I know how to code that.
[/quote]

That’s for C#. But it’ll probably work with VB too.[/quote]

In VB it would be msgbox(“if (command.startsWith” + textbox1.text + “) { //Continue code from here”)

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Snippet GUI
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

[quote=“Marine5287, post:3, topic:399835”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=496950.msg3633624#msg3633624 date=1308432368]
Pointless topic is pointless. If you want to release it, release it.

But… why Visual Basic… WHYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY
[/quote]

I didn’t know any other program :)[/quote]

Learn C#. It’s just as simple, and you won’t get ridiculed for it.

Quote from: Uncalled on June 21, 2011, 04:23:17 PM Try making it to where you need to add the inputs of the command [such as for the teleport command you type the x,y,h coords and the player rights] then when you're done, it will automatically add the command into your Commands class.

That’d be great, if I know how to code that.

That’s for C#. But it’ll probably work with VB too.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Snippet GUI
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Davidi2:

No offense, but that’s not a generator. If all it does is have a bunch of pre-made commands, it’s not a generator AT ALL. That’s called a snippet gui.

Thissss.

A generator would require the user to input parameters or data for the command (which the command will then use to produce the code).

Read full topic
